title: Accum Func FTC: graphical line segments part - a

content.description: The continuous function f is defined on the interval −5 ≤ x ≤ 8. The graph of f, which consists of four line segments, is shown in the figure above. Let g be the function given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4B95@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.
content.question: Find <math> <mi> g </mi> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mn> 0 </mn> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> </math> and <math> <mi> g </mi> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mrow> <mo> − </mo> <mn> 5 </mn> </mrow> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> </math> .

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
